Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How does this core facility and innovative instrument project enhance the research capability and competitiveness of Academia Sinica?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: This plan aims to enhance the research capabilities and competitiveness of Academia Sinica by enriching and effectively utilizing existing research resources, improving the service quality and efficiency of core facilities, and encouraging the development of innovative research instruments. This will help improve research standards, strengthen international standards, and promote domestic scientific and technological innovation and economic development.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How to improve the service quality and efficiency of core facilities?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: To improve the service quality and efficiency of core facilities, existing research resources can be enriched and effectively used, and research and development of new research instruments can be encouraged. In addition, professional training can also be carried out to improve the maintenance level of facilities, enhance special functions and support special research and technology development.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: What documents do I need to submit to apply for this program?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: To apply for this program, you need to submit a research proposal, personal resume, and a list of major works in recent years.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Which research facilities or instruments are eligible for grant recipients?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Research facilities or instruments that meet the requirements of the subsidy include: 1. Conforming to the key research directions of Academia Sinica, such as genomics, proteomics, metabolomics and other popular topics related to life sciences; 2. Multi-unit or interdisciplinary research of Academia Sinica Facilities with common needs; 3. Research facilities or instruments that require the assistance of professionals to conduct experiments; 4. Research facilities or instruments used to develop special research technologies or improve the special functions of equipment.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How does this plan help to promote technological innovation and economic development in the country?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: This plan helps to promote domestic scientific and technological innovation and economic development, mainly by improving the research capabilities and competitiveness of Academia Sinica. This will enable Academia Sinica to have a higher research level in the fields of genomics, proteomics, metabolomics and other life sciences. In addition, providing advanced research facilities and instruments so that different units or cross-field research teams can use them together will help promote domestic technological innovation and economic development.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Is this core facility construction plan intended for use by the whole hospital?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the goal of this core facility construction plan is to build new core facilities and make them available to everyone in the hospital.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Can only people who are full-time research assistants or full-time research assistants or above in Academia Sinica apply for this program?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, only full-time researchers and research technicians of Academia Sinica can apply for this program.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Can the project period be up to 5 years?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the program duration can be up to 5 years.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: If I want to continue the plan, do I have to apply in the last year before the plan expires?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, if you want to continue the program, you must apply in the last year before the program expires.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: The application should detail the funding, equipment, personnel and resource requirements as well as the project goals, methods and expected results, right?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the application should detail the required funds, equipment, personnel and other resources, as well as describe the goals, methods and expected results of the project.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Do I have to provide an estimated timeline and progress statement when I submit my application?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, an estimated timeline and progress statement is required with the application.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility construction plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Do we need to provide a method and standard for evaluating the progress and results of the project, as well as the expected contribution and application value?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, you need to provide a method and standard for evaluating the progress and results of the project in the application, and explain the expected contribution and application value.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Does the core facility maintenance plan allow all colleagues in the hospital to use shared research facilities?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the purpose of the core facility maintenance plan is to allow applicants to provide the shared research facilities established by each institute for the use of colleagues in the whole institute.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Only full-time research assistants or full-time research assistants of Academia Sinica can apply for this program, right?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, only full-time researchers or research technicians of Academia Sinica can apply for this program.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Can the duration of the project be 1 to 5 years?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the duration of the project can be 1 to 5 years.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How to extend the duration of the project? Do I need to submit the application form for the next term one year before the end of the project?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, if you want to extend the duration of the program, you can submit the application for the next term one year before the end of the program.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: What detailed plans should the application include, such as equipment, service content, charging prices, etc.?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: The application should include equipment, service content, charging price, and also need to explain the procedures and rules for using and booking equipment. In addition, it is also necessary to provide the expected benefit and contribution plan of the shared facilities, describe the existing usage and operation status, evaluation methods and standards, and the expected contribution and application value. At the same time, the expansion and renewal of shared facilities will also need to be discussed to ensure compliance with research needs and technological developments.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: What about procedures and rules for using and reserving equipment?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: If you want to know how to use and reserve the equipment, you can first go to the common form on the website of the Academic Office: https://daais.sinica.edu.tw/pages/797, and download the "Brief Description of Application Case" and "Brief Description of Reservation Equipment" �� file, just follow the instructions in the documentation.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Is it necessary to describe the current status and operation of the shared facilities in the application?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the application needs to describe the current status and operation of the shared facilities.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How should the applicant provide the methods and criteria for evaluating the progress and results of the project?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: In the application, the applicant needs to describe the methods and standards for evaluating the progress and results of the project. This may include setting clear goals, desired outcomes and timelines, as well as indicators or criteria by which to measure outcomes. The applicant should also suggest how to adjust the plan and standards according to the actual situation to ensure smooth progress.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How to describe the expected contribution and application value?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: To describe the expected contribution and application value, you can explain in the application that this project will help researchers and laboratories, such as providing more convenient and efficient instruments and equipment, so that researchers can more easily conduct experiments and Research. In addition, it is possible to explain how this common facility promotes academic exchange and collaboration, and what positive impact it has on research and technology development in related fields. Finally, the possibilities brought about by facility upgrades and expansions can also be emphasized to maintain Academia Sinica's advantage in research competition.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Core facility maintenance and operation plan
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: How to ensure that shared facilities can keep up with research needs and technological developments to expand and update?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: To ensure that shared facilities can keep up with the expansion and renewal of research needs and technological developments, applicants should discuss plans for expansion and renewal of shared facilities in their applications. This ensures that shared facilities remain in line with research needs and technological developments.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Innovative Instrument Development Project
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Is this innovative instrument development type project helping research instrumentation advance?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: That's right, the innovative instrument development plan is to develop new research instruments or facilities, and then set them up as core facilities for use by colleagues in Academia Sinica.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Innovative Instrument Development Project
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Is the qualification to apply for this program limited to full-time research assistants or full-time research assistants of Academia Sinica?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the qualifications to apply for this program are indeed limited to those who are full-time research assistants or full-time research assistants or above in Academia Sinica.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Innovative Instrument Development Project
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Can a program last up to five years?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, this program can last up to five years.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Innovative Instrument Development Project
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: As the program nears its end, you can apply early for the next program, right?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, when the plan is about to end and there is still one year left, you can apply for the next plan.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Innovative Instrument Development Project
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: The application should detail requirements for funding, equipment, personnel, and other resources, right?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, the application should detail the required funds, equipment, personnel and other resources.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Innovative Instrument Development Project
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: Applicants need to propose the goals, methods and expected results of the project, so should they also attach an estimated timetable?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, applicants need to provide an estimated timetable in the application, explaining the steps and progress of the planned implementation.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Core facilities and innovative instrumen.title: Innovative Instrument Development Project
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.question: In addition to describing the program objectives and expected results, is it necessary to provide the criteria and application value for evaluating progress and results?
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.answer: Yes, in addition to explaining the program goals and expected results, the applicant also needs to provide the methods and standards for evaluating the program progress and results, as well as the expected contribution and application value.
Core facilities and innovative instrumen.category: Core facilities and innovative instrument projects

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: non-captive core facility
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What is the goal of setting up the core facilities of the Center for Biomedical Translational Research?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: Provide high-end instruments, equipment and technical services required for research and development of biomedical translation such as disease prevention, detection, diagnosis and treatment for domestic manufacturers and domestic academic, research and industrial researchers, so as to accelerate domestic innovative precision medicine, medical materials, The translational research and preclinical verification (research proof-of-concept) schedule of new drugs, and successfully entered the stage of human clinical trials (IND-enabling studies), in order to enhance the international competitiveness and output of Taiwan's biomedical industry.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Drug synthesis and analysis core facilities
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What are the main problems that the Pharmaceutical Synthesis and Analysis Core Facility can be used to help solve?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: The core facilities for drug synthesis and analysis provide high-precision and high-resolution various structural identification and quantitative analysis services based on the strong strength and rich experience of Academia Sinica in small molecule qualitative and quantitative and structural biology, and assist the team stationed in the Biomedical Translation Research Center , All kinds of analysis required by manufacturers and domestic biomedical industry to develop large and small molecule drugs.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Drug synthesis and analysis core facilities
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: Which sub-core facilities are included in the Drug Synthesis and Analysis Core Facility?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: This facility is mainly divided into three units, which are nuclear magnetic resonance core facility, mass spectrometry core facility and chemical and drug synthesis unit.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Drug synthesis and analysis core facilities
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What professional services and consultations can the core facilities for drug synthesis and analysis provide to biotechnology manufacturers?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: This facility can provide many professional services and consultations for biotechnology manufacturers, including nuclear magnetic resonance, mass spectrometry, chemical and drug synthesis, etc. In addition, it also provides one-stop professional services and consultations from small molecule synthesis to macromolecular structure analysis, animal and molecular imaging.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Drug synthesis and analysis core facilities
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: Where can I obtain the introduction, usage rules, charging standards and contact information of each sub-core facility?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: Detailed information of each sub-core facility can be found on the following web pages: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance: https://biotrec.sinica.edu.tw/pages/2115, Mass Spectrometry: https://biotrec.sinica.edu.tw/pages/2116, Chemistry and Drug Synthesis: https://biotrec.sinica.edu.tw/pages/2118
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Human Therapeutic Antibody Development Platform
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: How to use the human therapeutic antibody research and development platform to assist in the development of new drugs?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: The human therapeutic antibody research and development platform assists the biotechnology industry to develop potential antibodies, accelerates the translation verification and clinical trials of new antibody drugs, thereby creating a niche for the new drug industry. The platform has successfully established a phage-displayed human natural antibody library containing more than 60 billion strains of human antibodies, and confirmed the diversity of antibodies through sequencing analysis. In addition, the platform also provides a number of services, such as human antibody preparation, monoclonal antibody preparation, etc., to meet the needs of customers.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Human Therapeutic Antibody Development Platform
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What is the process of preparing human antibodies for phage display antibody library?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: The process of preparing human antibodies by phage display antibody library is mainly to present a large number of human antibodies on the surface of phage, and then screen the target antigen. After screening, human antibodies with high specificity and affinity can be found, and these antibodies can be used for disease treatment and drug development.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Human Therapeutic Antibody Development Platform
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: How is mouse ascites antibody production and purification performed?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: The process of antibody production and purification in mouse ascites mainly includes the following steps: 1. Inject fusion tumor cells capable of producing antibodies into the abdomen of mice, allowing these cells to multiply and secrete antibodies in large numbers in the mice. 2. After a period of time, the fusion tumor cells will release a large amount of antibodies into the mouse ascites, forming the so-called "antibody concentration ascites". 3. Collect mouse ascites, which contains a large amount of antibodies. 4. Use purification technology such as FPLC chromatography to recover and purify the antibody to obtain high-quality antibodies for subsequent research. This whole process is an important service item in the human therapeutic antibody development platform to prepare antibodies with potential.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Human Therapeutic Antibody Development Platform
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What are the advantages of using the GH Antibody Library to develop antibodies against specific antigens?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: Using the GH antibody library to develop antibodies against specific antigens has the advantages of high specificity, neutrality, low immune rejection and low side effects. These characteristics make this antibody very effective in the clinical treatment of cancer, autoimmune diseases, and infectious diseases, and is a major trend in the development of new drugs worldwide. All in all, antibodies developed using the GH antibody library have broad application prospects and therapeutic potential.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Human Therapeutic Antibody Development Platform
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: Does the human therapeutic antibody R&D platform provide customized services?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: The customized services provided by the human therapeutic antibody research and development platform will be provided according to the needs of customers, and the specific content will be carried out according to customer requirements.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Human Therapeutic Antibody Development Platform
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: Where can I obtain the introduction, usage rules, charging standards and contact information of the facilities?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: Details of the facilities can be found on the following webpage: https://biotrec.sinica.edu.tw/pages/2091.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Taiwan Mouse Clinic
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What amenities are offered at Taiwan Mouse Clinic?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: The Taiwan Mouse Clinic mainly provides advanced and diversified phenotypic analysis services and standardized and customized package services for the safety and efficacy evaluation of various types of drugs, assisting the research and industry circles in the development of new drugs. The facilities can be divided into animal facilities and phenotype and drug efficacy analysis. Animal facilities provide basic experimental operation space, equipment and mouse purification services; phenotype and drug effect analysis provide domestic and foreign biomedical researchers with high-tech Experiments and research on phenotype identification technology, drug efficacy analysis and drug safety testing.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Taiwan Mouse Clinic
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What service items are included in the mouse surrogacy service?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: Mouse surrogacy provides a series of services, including basic experimental operation space and equipment, humanized intestinal microbial mice for new drug development, and mouse purification. In addition, mice are responsible for phenotyping, new drug drug development and animal imaging test analysis.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Taiwan Mouse Clinic
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What high-tech phenotyping techniques does Phenotyping and Pharmacodynamics provide?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: Phenotyping and pharmacodynamic analysis provides six types of high-tech phenotypic identification technologies, including experiments in neuroscience, cardiovascular disease, pathology research, physiological metabolism, biological imaging, and immune response.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Taiwan Mouse Clinic
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: How to assist drug safety testing and drug efficacy analysis through the services of the Taiwan Mouse Clinic?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: This facility assists drug safety testing and drug efficacy analysis through animal facilities and phenotype and drug efficacy analysis. Animal facilities provide surrogate mice, basic experimental equipment, and mouse purification services for new drug development and animal imaging test analysis. The phenotype and pharmacodynamic analysis provides six types of high-tech phenotype identification technologies for small animals, including experiments in neuroscience, cardiovascular disease, pathology research, physiological metabolism, biological imaging, and immune response. Through these experiments, it assists in drug efficacy analysis and drug safety testing, and promotes various researches that use small animals to study human disease models and drug development.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Taiwan Mouse Clinic
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: Where can I obtain the introduction, usage rules, charging standards and contact information of the facilities?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: Details of the facilities can be found on the following webpage: https://biotrec.sinica.edu.tw/posts/135922.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: Taiwan Mouse Clinic
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: How to assist in the development of new drugs through the services of the Taiwan Mouse Clinic?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: In order to assist the research and industry in the development of new drugs, this facility provides advanced and diversified phenotypic analysis services, and establishes standardized and customized package services for the safety and efficacy evaluation of sample drugs. In addition, it also provides high-tech phenotype identification technology and drug safety testing of small animals to promote various researches such as research on human disease models and drug development using small animals.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: animal imaging facility
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: How does the customized MRI and micro-CT imaging service provided by the animal imaging facility work?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: The animal imaging facility provides the most advanced nuclear magnetic resonance and computerized tomography technical support, and will conduct customized MRI and micro-CT image scanning according to customer needs and experimental design to meet the needs of biotechnology research and development, drug development and translation research, etc. aspects of demand. The content of the service covers the collection and analysis of imaging data, as well as biomedical application research and other fields, aiming to assist the development and competitiveness of Taiwan's biomedical industry.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: animal imaging facility
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: Does Animal Imaging Facility provide customized animal models, and what package services are included?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: The animal imaging facility provides customized animal models and various customized evaluation packages. For specific service items, please refer to the facility website https://biotrec.sinica.edu.tw/pages/2136. If you have further questions, please feel free to contact the facility.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: animal imaging facility
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What are professional image interpretation and special image post-processing services?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: Professional image interpretation and special image post-processing services refer to providing professional analysis of MRI and computerized tomography images according to different needs, as well as further processing or adjustment of images to help users obtain clearer and more accurate results in research or application. result.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: animal imaging facility
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What is the full range of animal experimentation consultation, planning and experiment design offered by Animal Imaging Facility?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: Animal imaging facilities provide comprehensive animal experiment consultation, planning and experimental design, including customized MRI/micro-CT imaging services, customized animal models and various customized evaluation package services, professional image interpretation and special image post-processing services, and non-liveness scanning services. Through these services, we assist the industry and academia to accelerate biotechnology research and development, drug development and translational research, and promote the development and international competitiveness of Taiwan's biomedical industry.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: animal imaging facility
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: What are the features of the ultra-high resolution small animal in vivo tomography scanner at the Animal Imaging Facility?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: This ultra-high-resolution small animal living tomography scanner is characterized by its ability to provide very high image quality and details, which is especially helpful for the research and observation of small animals. Provide important support for biotechnology research and development, drug development and other fields in the industry and academia.
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.title: animal imaging facility
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.question: Where can I obtain the introduction, usage rules, charging standards and contact information of the facilities?
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.answer: Details of the facilities can be found on the following website: https://biotrec.sinica.edu.tw/pages/2136
Entered the non-exclusive core facilitie.category: Entered the non-exclusive core facilities of the Biomedical Translation Research Center

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Hospital-wide core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Are the hospital-wide core facilities open to all researchers of Academia Sinica?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, the campus-wide core facilities are open to all researchers at Academia Sinica.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Hospital-wide core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Is there a fee to use these hospital-wide core facilities?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, there is a fee to use these hospital-wide core facilities, primarily to recover maintenance costs.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Hospital-wide core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: In addition to providing the latest equipment, what other assistance is there?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: In addition to providing the latest instruments and equipment, the hospital-wide core facilities also have full-time staff who can assist in designing experiments, conducting sample testing and analyzing experimental data. At the same time, it also provides instrument operator training and professional technical consultation.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Hospital-wide core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Are these campus-wide core facilities specialized in different technical areas?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, the hospital-wide core facilities specialize in different technical fields, and can provide scientific instruments required for scientific experimental research, cutting-edge technology for product development, as well as instrument operator training and professional technical consultation.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Hospital-wide core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: If I want to use the hospital-wide core facilities, how can I find the contact information?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to use the hospital-wide core facilities, you can go to the website of each core facility to view the contact information of the facility contractors. In addition, for detailed descriptions of each facility, please refer to this website: https://daais.sinica.edu.tw/pages/519.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Hospital-wide core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Which website should I refer to for detailed instructions on facilities?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To view the detailed description of the facilities, you can refer to this website: https://daais.sinica.edu.tw/pages/519.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Hospital-wide core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Apart from researchers at Academia Sinica, can external units use the campus-wide core facilities?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The units outside the hospital can be used when there is enough service in the core facilities of the whole hospital. However, it is recommended to check the contact information of the organizers on the website of each core facility and confirm whether there are resources available.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Core Facility for Transgenic Mice
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Is this transgenic mouse core facility a place to help researchers produce genetically modified mice?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, the core facility for genetically modified mice is a place dedicated to helping researchers produce genetically modified mice, and also provides other related technical services.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Core Facility for Transgenic Mice
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Which two gene editing techniques have been successfully established at the Transgenic Mice Core Facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The Core Facility for Transgenic Mice has successfully established two gene editing technologies, Transcription Activator-Like Nucleic Acid (TALEN) and Cluster-Associated Protein of Constant Palindromic Repeats (CRISPR).

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Core Facility for Transgenic Mice
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: The well-known TALEN and CRISPR technology names are abbreviations, right?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, both TALEN and CRISPR are acronyms. TALEN is the abbreviation of Transcription Activator-like Effectors Nuclease, and CRISPR is the abbreviation of Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats, both of which are gene editing technologies used to produce genetically modified mice.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Core Facility for Transgenic Mice
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Do they introduce new research techniques every year to improve experimental efficiency?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, they introduce new research techniques every year to improve the efficiency of gene editing experiments and hopefully shorten the time to produce genetically modified mice.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Core Facility for Transgenic Mice
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: From TALEN/CRISPR technology to in vitro fertilization, what are the main programs offered by this facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main projects provided by this facility include production of transgenic or knockout mice, production of genetically modified mice using TALEN/CRISPR technology, genetic targeting of mouse embryonic stem cells, conditional gene knockout, chimeric mouse production, embryonic Freezing, sperm freezing, in vitro fertilization and embryo transfer, etc. In addition, they also provide services such as experimental design consultation on tool mice and transgenic mice.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Core Facility for Transgenic Mice
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main equipment of the core facility for transgenic mice?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main equipment of this core facility for transgenic mice includes a transgenic machine, a microinjection system, a needle puller and a needle caster.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Core Facility for Transgenic Mice
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who manages this core facility and what is his role?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to know about the core facility managers, please visit the facility website: https://www.imb.sinica.edu.tw/TCF/.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Core Facility for Transgenic Mice
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: I would like to know more about the core facilities of genetically modified mice. Where can I find the usage rules, charging standards and contact information?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to know more about the core facilities of transgenic mice, including usage rules, charging standards and contact information, you can visit this website: https://www.imb.sinica.edu.tw/TCF/.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Public Animal Facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What kind of service does this public animal facility mainly provide?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This public animal facility is mainly to provide Academia Sinica research colleagues with a surrogacy space for experimental animals that is free from specific pathogens, and to provide services for borrowing instruments and equipment for anesthesia, operation, sampling and monitoring of mouse physiological signals.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Public Animal Facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What review process is required before applying to use a shared animal facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Before applying for the use of public animal facilities, the research plan must first be reviewed and approved by the Laboratory Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) of the Academia Sinica, and then the animal health monitoring report must be prepared for review by the facility organizer, and the laboratory animal entry procedure can only be carried out after approval.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Public Animal Facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What does specific disease-free SPF mouse surrogacy service mean?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Specific pathogen-free SPF mouse surrogacy service refers to providing an environment free of specific pathogens, allowing these mice to live and reproduce in such an environment to ensure that they will not be affected by diseases. This can effectively maintain the stability and reliability of the experiment.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Public Animal Facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What types of animal experiments does the facility primarily support?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The facility mainly supports animal experiments related to tumor testing, drug testing, immunity, neurology and development.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Public Animal Facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main equipment of public animal facilities?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main equipment of public animal facilities includes independent ventilation feeding system, biological safety cabinet, air anesthesia machine and live cold light system.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Public Animal Facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: On which floor are the facilities located? Who will manage it?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to know the location and management staff of this core facility, please go to the dedicated facility website: https://ascore.sinica.edu.tw/.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Public Animal Facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How to inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of public animal facilities?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: You can go to this website to check the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of public animal facilities: https://ascore.sinica.edu.tw/.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biophysics Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who is the Biophysics Core facility open to?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The biophysics core facilities are mainly open to researchers from Academia Sinica, as well as people from domestic universities and other academic research institutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biophysics Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What molecular qualitative analyzes can I perform at this facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: In the Biophysics Core Facility, you can use a variety of molecular qualitative analysis instruments to understand the physicochemical properties of biomolecules, such as particle size, molecular weight, as well as thermodynamic, kinetic and structural information on interactions between biomolecules. The main equipment includes analytical ultra-high-speed centrifuge, surface plasmon resonance biomolecular sensor, circular dichroism instrument, isothermal titration enthalpy meter, thermal differential scanning calorimeter, protein stability analyzer, high-throughput biological Thin film interferometer, dynamic light scattering instrument, viscometer and density meter, etc. Finally, it should be noted that the charging standards and usage rules of each facility can be further viewed through this website: http://bcf.daais.sinica.edu.tw/index_C.html.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biophysics Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Does the facility offer educational training and instrument operator certification courses?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, the facility will not only conduct educational training on various instruments from time to time, but also provide paid instrument operation certification courses. Qualified users can make an appointment to operate the instrument by themselves.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biophysics Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: If I want to make an appointment to use one of these instruments, do I need to pay?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, if you want to make an appointment to use the instrument, there is a fee. For specific charging standards, please refer to their official website: http://bcf.daais.sinica.edu.tw/index_C.html.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biophysics Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where is the facility located?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This facility is located in Room 402, 4th Floor, Institute of Biochemistry, Academia Sinica.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biophysics Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where can I find information about terms of use and contact information?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: You can find information such as usage rules, fees and contact information on the official website of the Biophysics Core Facility. The URL is: http://bcf.daais.sinica.edu.tw/index_C.html.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biosafety Level 3 Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: In what year was this biosafety level 3 laboratory opened?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The third level of biosafety laboratory was opened in June 2009.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biosafety Level 3 Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Is the main research object the personnel of Academia Sinica or other institutions?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main research object is the researchers of Academia Sinica, but it will also conduct research cooperation with domestic public and private universities, research institutions and biotechnology industry.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biosafety Level 3 Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What types of experiments can this P3 laboratory do?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This P3 laboratory can mainly conduct operational experiments on viruses of Risk Group 3, such as dangerous biosafety, but does not include bacterial infection and animal experiments. At the same time, this laboratory can improve Taiwan's capabilities in the research, prevention and control of dangerous viruses, and biosafety protection.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biosafety Level 3 Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What training and certification do operators need to receive before using the P3 laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Before using the P3 laboratory, operators need to receive training in accordance with the laboratory's standard operating procedures, and only after passing the certification can they independently operate high-risk pathogens for experiments.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biosafety Level 3 Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main equipment of this P3 laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main equipment includes a full negative pressure environment and Class II-A2, B2 biosafety operation cabinets.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Biosafety Level 3 Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where can we inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of this laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: You can check the relevant information of this laboratory on the website of the Institute of Biomedical Sciences of Academia Sinica at https://www.ibms.sinica.edu.tw/support_dep/full_version/index28.html.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Experimental Plant Core Greenhouse Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Which units are the experimental plant core greenhouse facilities mainly provided for?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This experimental plant core greenhouse facility is mainly provided to researchers of Academia Sinica, domestic universities and other academic research institutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Experimental Plant Core Greenhouse Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How to make an appointment to use this greenhouse facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To make an appointment to use this greenhouse facility, you can refer to the official website of the Academia Sinica Experimental Plant Core Greenhouse Facility: http://abrc.sinica.edu.tw/greenhouse/, where you can find usage rules, charging standards and contact information.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Experimental Plant Core Greenhouse Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What professional services does this facility offer to help researchers?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This facility provides plant growth space, plant gene transfer service, plant planting valet operation, medium management material service, as well as special personnel to assist in maintaining constant temperature and humidity of plant growth equipment, management of diseases and insect pests, and soil fertilization and cultivation, which is convenient for researchers to carry out plant growth and development Related research.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Experimental Plant Core Greenhouse Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How many units are available to researchers in the facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: There are 140 units available to researchers within the facility.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Experimental Plant Core Greenhouse Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: In addition to basic plant growth equipment, what auxiliary facilities are there to facilitate experimental operations?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: In addition to basic plant growth equipment, there are auxiliary facilities for convenient experimental operations such as plant photography room, medium room, soil preparation room and public laboratory.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Experimental Plant Core Greenhouse Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main equipment?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main equipment includes walk-in growth room, high-light growth room, single-door and double-door plant growth box, net room and glass room greenhouse, experimental plant photography room and autoclave.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Experimental Plant Core Greenhouse Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: In which area of ??Academia Sinica is the facility located?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The facility is located at the new Greenhouse Building and Molecular Breeding Greenhouse at the bottom of Shengke Avenue, Academia Sinica.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Experimental Plant Core Greenhouse Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How to inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of the experimental plant core greenhouse facilities?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of the experimental plant core greenhouse facilities, you can refer to this website: http://abrc.sinica.edu.tw/greenhouse/.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Experimental Plant Core Greenhouse Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Can I seek professional assistance in maintaining constant temperature and humidity of plant growth equipment, managing pests and diseases, and soil fertilization and cultivation?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Of course, the experimental plant core greenhouse facilities will provide special personnel to assist in maintaining constant temperature and humidity of plant growth equipment, management of diseases and insect pests, and soil fertilization and cultivation.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Nucleic Acid Sequencing Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: In what year did this nucleic acid sequencing facility start providing services?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This nucleic acid sequencing facility started providing services in 2005.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Nucleic Acid Sequencing Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Which organizations do you mainly serve?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: It mainly provides services for researchers of Academia Sinica, domestic universities and other academic research institutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Nucleic Acid Sequencing Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the characteristics of Sanger sequencing method, why choose it for nucleic acid sequencing analysis?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The Sanger sequencing method is characterized by fast and accurate, it is the preferred tool to confirm the sequence of short fragments (less than 1Kbp). Using it for nucleic acid sequencing analysis can ensure the correctness of the results, so we choose it for nucleic acid sequencing analysis.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Nucleic Acid Sequencing Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Is there a dedicated staff to handle and analyze the samples?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, Facility Services has dedicated personnel to operate the instruments and analyze the samples.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Nucleic Acid Sequencing Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main service projects?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main service projects include plastid double-stranded DNA sequencing, cosmid vector DNA sequencing, PCR product DNA sequencing, and nucleic acid sequencing experiment design consultation.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Nucleic Acid Sequencing Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What is the main equipment used in this facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: There are two main equipment used in this facility, one is ABI 3730xl DNA nucleic acid analysis system, and the other is gradient nucleic acid amplification instrument.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Nucleic Acid Sequencing Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where is the nucleic acid sequencing facility located at Academia Sinica?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The nucleic acid sequencing facility is located in room N719 on the 7th floor of the Institute of Biomedicine, Academia Sinica.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Nucleic Acid Sequencing Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who is in charge of managing this facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to know the management personnel of this core facility, please visit the facility dedicated website: https://www.ibms.sinica.edu.tw/support_dep/index21.html.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Nucleic Acid Sequencing Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How to inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of nucleic acid sequencing facilities?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To inquire about the use rules, charging standards and contact information of nucleic acid sequencing facilities, you can go to this website to view: https://www.ibms.sinica.edu.tw/support_dep/index21.html

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Life science electric display core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: For which service projects are the core facilities of life science teledisplay mainly established?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The core facilities of life science electric imaging are mainly set up for the following service projects: 1. Provide sample preparation services, such as negative staining, metal projection, tissue embedding, etc.; 2. Electron microscope imaging services; 3. For independent use of facilities Provide one-to-one instrument teaching for users; 4. Electron microscope experiment design consulting services.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Life science electric display core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main equipment provided by this facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main equipment provided by this facility are: 1. FEI Tecnai G2 F20 S-Twin field emission transmission electron microscope; 2. FEI Quanta 200 scanning electron microscope; 3. Microwave processor for biological samples; 4. Leica high pressure freezing and automatic Freeze replacement system; 5. Ultra-high vacuum carbon coating device and glow discharge system; 6. Ultrathin microtome.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Life science electric display core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: If I need to use the facilities and equipment independently, can I provide one-on-one instrument teaching service?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, they offer one-on-one instrument instruction if you need independent use of the facility.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Life science electric display core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who are the life science TV display core facilities mainly serving?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The core facilities of life science electric display mainly provide services for researchers of Academia Sinica, research and development personnel of domestic universities and private enterprises.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Life science electric display core facilities
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where can I check the usage rules, charging standards and contact information?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: You can see the usage rules, charging standards and contact information at this URL: https://image-core.icob.sinica.edu.tw/pages/3788.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: New Generation Genome Sequencing Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What is the purpose of the Next Generation Genome Sequencing Core Facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The New Generation Genome Sequencing Core Facility was originally established to support the strain sequencing of the National Biomass Energy Research Program. Later, under the impetus of the Academia Sinica Nucleic Acid Sequencing User Committee, it began to provide services to colleagues in the whole academy, and also provided services to other academic research institutions one after another.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: New Generation Genome Sequencing Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who is its main target audience?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main service targets are researchers of Academia Sinica, domestic universities and other academic research institutions.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: New Generation Genome Sequencing Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the main service items offered by this facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: This facility mainly provides five service projects, including DNA/RNA sample quality testing, gene library construction and library quality testing, use of internal reference genes to calibrate transcription effects, genome sequencing and NGS genome sequencing experiment design consulting services.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: New Generation Genome Sequencing Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the major pieces of equipment in this facility?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main equipment in this facility includes Illumina HiSeq 2500 high-throughput genome analysis system, Illumina MiSeq genome multifunctional analysis system, Illumina NextSeq 2000 high-throughput genome sequencing system, PacBio Sequel system third-generation sequencer, Oxford Nanopore GridION MK1 third-generation single-molecule high-throughput genome sequencing system, 10x Genomics Chromium single-cell analysis system, Agilent BioAnalyzer biochemical analyzer, Agilent Fragment Analyzer biochemical analyzer, Agilent FEMTO Pulse Automated Pulsed-Field Capillary Electrophoresis Analyzer, M220 focused ultrasound instrument, and Sage Science BluePippin and ELF automatic DNA fragment recovery system.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: New Generation Genome Sequencing Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who is the Facilities Supervisor and what is his/her role?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to know the management personnel of this core facility, please visit the dedicated facility website: https://ngs.biodiv.tw/NGSCore/.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: New Generation Genome Sequencing Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where is the Next Generation Genome Sequencing Core Facility located?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The new-generation genome sequencing core facility is located in Room A603 on the 6th floor of the Interdisciplinary Science and Technology Research Building of the Academia Sinica.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: New Generation Genome Sequencing Core Facility
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where should we inquire about usage rules, charging standards and contact information?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To learn about usage rules, charging standards and contact information, you can go to this website: http://ngs.biodiv.tw/NGSCore/.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Neuroscience Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What two types of services does the Neuroscience Core Laboratory mainly provide?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The neuroscience core laboratory mainly provides two types of services: electrophysiology and imaging.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Neuroscience Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Is the laboratory open to applications from academic units outside the hospital?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Yes, the neuroelectrophysiology laboratory is open to applications from academic units outside the hospital, and scholars inside and outside the hospital are welcome to make more use of it.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Neuroscience Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are their main service projects?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: Their main service projects include extracellular group excitatory post-synaptic potential recording of tissue slices, planar microelectrode array recording, whole-cell clamp membrane recording, calcium ion image recording, conjugate focal microscopy image acquisition, light stimulation and other image analysis experiments , and optical recording of membrane potential with voltage-sensitive dyes.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Neuroscience Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What major equipment can be found in the Neuroscience Core Laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: In the neuroscience core laboratory, you can find the following main equipment: electrophysiological signal recording platform with light stimulation light source system, ED64 microelectrode array recording system, Zeiss inverted microscope whole-cell clamp membrane recording platform, Zeiss observer.D1 calcium ion imaging Platform, Zeiss LSM880 confocal microscope (including Airyscan and in vivo experiment function), MiCAM05 imaging platform, oscillating microtome D.S.K. microslicer DTK-1000, horizontal needle puller SUTTER MODEL P-97 Pipette puller, glass electrode needle puller NARISHIGE PC -10. Micro-Osmometer Model 3300, an osmotic pressure detector, and IMARIS imaging software.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Neuroscience Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where are the laboratory facilities located?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The laboratory facilities are located in Room I-07 on the second basement floor of the Interdisciplinary Science and Technology Research Building of Academia Sinica.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Neuroscience Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Which two institutes are the people responsible for managing the labs from?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The staff who manage the laboratories are from the Institute of Biomedical Sciences and the Institute of Molecular Biology respectively.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Neuroscience Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How to inquire about the rules of use, charging standards and contact information of the Neuroscience Core Laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To inquire about the rules of use, charging standards and contact information of the Neuroscience Core Laboratory, you can directly visit their website at http://npas.programs.sinica.edu.tw/npas_core_facility.html. On this site you will find all the information you need.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Transgenic Plant Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: When did the core laboratory of transgenic plants start to provide services?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The core laboratory for transgenic plants has provided services since July 1998.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Transgenic Plant Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What kind of service projects do you mainly provide?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main service items provided include Agrobacterium transformation services for 8 kinds of plants, plant gene transformation experiment materials, use of gene guns, as well as plant gene transformation experiment design consulting services and education and training courses.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Transgenic Plant Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: What are the facilities of this laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The main equipment in the laboratory includes walk-in growth chamber, desktop gene gun BIO-RAD PDS-1000 and hand-held gene gun, exponential wave and square wave electroporation instrument, fluorescent microscope, dissecting microscope, vibrating microtome, Aseptic operating table, sterilizing pot and related equipment for plant tissue culture.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Transgenic Plant Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Where is the address of the Transplant Plant Core Laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: The core laboratory of transgenic plants is located on the second floor of the new greenhouse building at the bottom of Shengke Avenue, Academia Sinica.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Transgenic Plant Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: Who is in charge of running the laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: If you want to know the management personnel of this core laboratory, please go to the facility website: https://abrc.sinica.edu.tw/greenhouse/.

Hospital-wide core facilities.title: Transgenic Plant Core Laboratory
Hospital-wide core facilities.question: How to inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of the Transplanted Plant Core Laboratory?
Hospital-wide core facilities.answer: To inquire about the usage rules, charging standards and contact information of the Transplant Plant Core Laboratory, you can go to this website: http://abrc.sinica.edu.tw/transplant/.

plan application.title: application 1
plan application.question: How many types of Academia Sinica competitive academic research project funding?
plan application.answer: Academia Sinica's competitive academic research project funding is divided into three types, namely the first type: deep cultivation of basic research, excellence type, including forward-looking projects, deep cultivation projects and theme research projects; The second type: Pursue key issues and breakthroughs in emerging fields, including Grand Challenge Program for seed grants and Grand Challenge Programs; The third type: mission-oriented, including sustainable scientific research projects, mission-oriented biotechnology research projects, epidemic response research projects, materials and analysis technology exploration projects (iMATE) and digital humanities research projects.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: application 2
plan application.question: How does Academia Sinica allocate funds according to different project types?
plan application.answer: When the Academia Sinica allocates funds, it will arrange according to the type of the project, whether it is individual or team integration, the scale and depth of the project, and benefit evaluation. They will rigorously plan allocations with reference to past experience and analytical reviews, while incorporating and revising results from relevant practical research for program review. In addition, they will also carry out follow-up management and assessment operations such as mid-term report review, implementation of expiry report evaluation, plan changes, and funding control. Each plan has a rolling adjustment mechanism for subsidy amounts to ensure optimal operation. benefit.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: application 3
plan application.question: I want to apply for the first and second types of project funding, how do I start?
plan application.answer: If you want to apply for the first, second and third types of project funding, you can first go to this website to learn about the introduction, application method and schedule of each project: https://sub.daais.sinica.edu.tw/grants/index. html. When applying, log in to the Academia Sinica academic service management system at https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/. Then follow the system guidelines to apply.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Li Jiayin 02-27899476 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613

plan application.title: Review 1
plan application.question: How is the review job divided into three phases?
plan application.answer: The review operation is divided into three stages. Firstly, the experts in the project field conduct a written review, then enter the re-examination stage, and finally conduct a final review.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: Review 2
plan application.question: What are the main issues to be addressed in the review?
plan application.answer: The focus of the review is mainly to solve important key issues, the degree of innovation, the degree of expected impact and international competitiveness.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: review 3
plan application.question: How to evaluate the degree of innovation and international competitiveness?
plan application.answer: The evaluation of the degree of innovation and international competitiveness is mainly through the written review of experts in the project field, and then through three stages of review and final review. During this process, the review committee will conduct discussion and evaluation based on the performance of various projects and the similarity of themes, together with the views of Academia Sinica, to ensure the fairness and effectiveness of the evaluation.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: review 4
plan application.question: Under the new system, how are various research projects evaluated by the three academic committees?
plan application.answer: Under the new system, various research projects are discussed and evaluated by the review committees of the three academic groups of Mathematical Sciences, Life Sciences, and Humanities and Social Sciences, and decisions are made based on the views of Academia Sinica. This approach helps to fully consider the level of each application and the similarity of themes, making the funding more fair and effective.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: review 5
plan application.question: How does this review method ensure the fairness and effectiveness of grants?
plan application.answer: This review method mainly passes through three stages: written review, review and final review to ensure the fairness and effectiveness of financial subsidies. First, experts conduct a written review of the plan. Then, various projects in the same field will be submitted to the review committees of the three academic groups of mathematical sciences, life sciences, humanities and social sciences for evaluation. In the end, Academia Sinica will make decisions based on these scoring results and its own opinions. This approach allows the entire review process to more fully take into account the quality and topical similarity of each application, thereby ensuring that funding is more fair and effective.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676 Chen Yijun 02-27872612 Bai Qianhua 02-27872613 Zhang Yuanzhen 02-27872614 Li Li Wen 02-27892575 Li Jiayin 02-27899476

plan application.title: implement
plan application.question: How does the rolling grant amount mechanism for these research programs work?
