plan application.answer: The rolling adjustment subsidy amount mechanism of these research projects is based on the progress and results of the projects, and continues to carry out follow-up evaluation operations such as mid-term report review, implementation expiration report evaluation, project changes, and funding control. After evaluation, the subsidy amount will be adjusted according to the actual situation of the project to achieve the best operational efficiency.

plan application.title: Career Development Award 1
plan application.question: How can I participate in the Career Development Award?
plan application.answer: To participate in this program, you must first be a full-time assistant researcher, a non-permanent research fellow of Academia Sinica, or a newly recruited research assistant or non-permanent associate researcher at various research institutes and research centers of Academia Sinica. Next, apply during the period from March to May each year, submit the letter of intent in early April, and then ask the recommending unit to submit the paper plan information in early May. After that, it is time to wait for the written preliminary review, re-examination and final review process. In November, the applications that pass the review will be announced, and the plans that pass the review will be implemented in January of the following year. Remember to prepare a research proposal, a personal resume and a list of major works when applying, as well as letters of recommendation and relevant meeting minutes. For more information and how to apply, please visit the relevant website of Academia Sinica.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.title: Career Development Award 2
plan application.question: What is the upper limit of funding for the Career Development Award?
plan application.answer: The upper limit of funding for this project is NT$5 million.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.answer: The Career Development Award will set up a specific plan to allow young scholars to conduct forward-looking research topics with international competitiveness. This approach helps to select outstanding young scholars with potential for development and cultivate them to become the world's top academic talents.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Xu Jingping 02-27899351 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386

plan application.title: Investigator Award 1
plan application.question: What is the Investigator Award for?
plan application.answer: Investigator Award is mainly to support and cultivate potential researchers of Academia Sinica, so that they can focus on original research on important topics. It is hoped that they will have world-class achievements in various fields, such as life sciences, mathematical sciences, humanities and social sciences. important contribution of the level.

plan application.title: Investigator Award 2
plan application.question: How long will the Investigator Award take in total?
plan application.answer: This project will take a total of 5 years.

plan application.title: Investigator Award 3
plan application.question: What are the application and review procedures for Investigator Award of Academia Sinica?
plan application.answer: The application and review procedures for Investigator Award of Academia Sinica are very strict. After application, recommendation and review, candidates can receive five years of research funding support.

plan application.title: Investigator Award 4
plan application.question: What are the review steps in the application process of Investigator Award?
plan application.answer: There are several review stages in the application process. First, domestic and foreign scholars and experts conduct a preliminary written review, then the committees of each academic group conduct re-examination, and finally there is a joint final review meeting of the three academic groups. Approved applications will be announced in November.

plan application.title: Investigator Award 5
plan application.question: What is the upper limit of funding for Investigator Award?
plan application.answer: The upper limit of funding for the Deep Cultivation Project is NT$5 million.

plan application.title: Investigator Award 6
plan application.question: What qualifications do I need to apply for Investigator Award?
plan application.answer: To apply for this program, the host must be a researcher above the full-time associate researcher of Academia Sinica.

plan application.title: Investigator Award 7
plan application.question: When should I apply for Investigator Award?
plan application.answer: You can apply for this program from March to May every year, submit a letter of intent in early April, and then submit a proposal in early May.

plan application.title: Investigator Award 8
plan application.question: How do I apply for Investigator Award?
plan application.answer: To apply for Investigator Award, you must first ensure that you are a researcher above the full-time associate researcher of the Academia Sinica. Then, during the application period from March to May each year, the letter of intent is submitted at the beginning of April, and documents such as the research plan and personal resume are submitted at the beginning of May. Please refer to Academia Sinica��s Intensive Cultivation Program Operation Points for detailed application content. Plans that pass the review will be implemented in January of the following year, with an upper limit of NT$5 million. For more information, please refer to the relevant website or log in to the academic service management system of Academia Sinica to apply.

plan application.title: Investigator Award 9

plan application.title: Thematic Research Project 1
plan application.question: What is the purpose of setting up the theme research plan?
plan application.answer: Thematic research projects are to promote the research projects of Academia Sinica and make important world-class contributions in the field of basic research.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Thematic Research Project 2

plan application.answer: This project is three-year, divided into two types: individual research project and single integrated research project.
plan application.contact: Zhao Wanling 02-27898067 Zeng Jinzheng 02-27899386 Jian Meixiu 02-27899676

plan application.title: Thematic Research Project 3

plan application.answer: The theme research plan will select forward-looking and representative research topics in the three major fields of mathematical sciences, life sciences, and humanities and social sciences. plan application.answer: The person who implements this project must be a full-time researcher of Academia Sinica.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program for seed grant 1
plan application.question: What kind of challenges does the Grand Challenge Program for seed grant address?
plan application.answer: The Grand Challenge Program for seed grant is designed to address research challenges where concepts are still in their infancy but have originality and potential for development.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program for seed grant 2
plan application.question: What important scientific and social problems does the Grand Challenge Program for seed grant hope to solve in the future?
plan application.answer: The important scientific and social issues that these research projects hope to solve in the future include gene and cell therapy, data science, air pollution, quantum technology, future society, social investigation of totalitarian regimes, major diseases and precision medicine, agricultural biotechnology and health and longevity, etc. field challenges. These studies can not only help us overcome the current difficulties we are facing, but also allow us to fulfill the duties of the country's top research institutions and scientists.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program for seed grant 3
plan application.question: What is the difference between the Grand Challenge Program for seed grant and the Grand Challenge Program?
plan application.answer: The main difference between the Grand Challenge Program for seed grant and the Grand Challenge Program is the program duration and research phase. The term of the seed grant is 1 to 2 years, which is suitable for the research that is still in the embryonic stage of the concept, which has originality and development potential; while the period of the Grand Challenge Program is 5 years, which is suitable for the research with a more specific concept and a relatively mature research program.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program for seed grant 4
plan application.question: How do I apply for the Grand Challenge Program?
plan application.answer: To apply for the Grand Challenge Program, you need to log in to the Academia Sinica Academic Service Management System https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/, and prepare the following documents within the application period: research proposal, personal resume and major works in recent years Table of contents. There are two tiers of application each year, the first tier application period is from January to March, and the second tier application period is from July to September. The application then goes through a three-stage review. The plans approved in the first tier will be implemented in July of the same year, and the plans approved in the second tier will be implemented in January of the following year. For details on the application, please refer to the "Academia Sinica Key Breakthrough Program Operation Key Points", and related information can be found at https://www.sinica.edu.tw/ch/articles/425.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program for seed grant 5
plan application.question: Does the host of the application need to be a full-time researcher of Academia Sinica?
plan application.answer: Yes, the moderator must be a full-time researcher of Academia Sinica.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program for seed grant 6
plan application.question: The application time is divided into two tiers each year. When are they?
plan application.answer: There are two tiers of application time each year, the first tier application period is from January to March, and the second tier application period is from July to September.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program for seed grant 7
plan application.question: What documents do I need to submit when applying?
plan application.answer: When applying, you need to submit a research proposal, personal resume, and a list of major works in recent years.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program for seed grant 8
plan application.question: On which system should I log in to apply for the Grand Challenge Program for seed grant?
plan application.answer: To log in and apply for this program, please visit https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/ of Academia Sinica��s academic service management system.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program for seed grant 9
plan application.question: If I want to know more details about the Grand Challenge Program for seed grant, where should I go?
plan application.answer: For more details about the program, please refer to https://sub.daais.sinica.edu.tw/grants/gcs.html.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program 1
plan application.question: What is the goal of the Grand Challenge Program?
plan application.answer: The goal of the Grand Challenge Program is to enhance the basic research of Academia Sinica, encourage researchers to pay attention to social and academic challenges that need to be solved urgently, analyze existing limitations, find out the core of the problem, and propose a breakthrough solution strategy, and finally achieve To achieve the goal of world-class research.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program 2
plan application.question: How does the Grand Challenge Program select key academic issues that are in line with Academia Sinica and the country's social development?
plan application.answer: The Grand Challenge Program will carefully select key academic issues that are consistent with the development of Academia Sinica and the country and society. These issues are usually brave enough to challenge and break through existing bottlenecks, such as gene and cell therapy, data science, air pollution, quantum technology, etc. During the selection process, we hope to find research projects that have the potential to solve important scientific and social problems, and fulfill the duties of the country's top research institutions and scientists.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program 3
plan application.question: What are the three sizes of Grand Challenge Program?
plan application.answer: There are three types of Grand Challenge Program, which are individual research projects, single-integrated research projects, and institute-centered problem-oriented team research projects.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program 4
plan application.question: What are the homework points to be followed when applying for a Grand Challenge Program?
plan application.answer: To apply for the Grand Challenge Program, you need to follow the "Academia Sinica Grand Challenge Program Operation Key Points". For details, please refer to the relevant website of the Academia Sinica.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program 5
plan application.question: Who can serve as a host for a Grand Challenge Program?
plan application.answer: The full-time researchers of Academia Sinica can serve as the hosts of key breakthrough projects.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program 6
plan application.question: When can you usually apply for the Grand Challenge Program?
plan application.answer: Generally, you can apply for the Grand Challenge Program from March to May each year. A letter of intent must be submitted in early April, followed by a proposal in early May.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program 7
plan application.question: What documents do I need to prepare to apply for the Grand Challenge Program?
plan application.answer: To apply for the Grand Challenge Program, you need to prepare a research proposal, personal resume, and a catalog of major works in recent years.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program 8
plan application.question: What is the funding cap for the Grand Challenge Program?
plan application.answer: The funding ceiling for the Grand Challenge Program is NT$20 million.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program 9
plan application.question: After the application for the Grand Challenge Program is approved, when will it start to be implemented?
plan application.answer: Grand Challenge Program that pass the review will begin implementation in January of the following year.

plan application.title: Grand Challenge Program 10
plan application.question: How to inquire about the detailed description and application process of the Grand Challenge Program?
plan application.answer: To inquire about the detailed description and application process of the Grand Challenge Program, you can check it on the official website at https://sub.daais.sinica.edu.tw/grants/gcp.html. If you want to apply for the program, you can also log in to the Academia Sinica academic service management system https://asms.sinica.edu.tw/.

plan application.title: Sustainability Science Research Program 1
plan application.question: What are the key sustainable issues to be solved in the sustainable scientific research plan, and what are the specific contents of the promotion direction?
plan application.answer: The key sustainable issues to be solved by this plan are the following six directions: 1. Energy and carbon reduction technology, 2. Food, air, water protection and safety, 3. Transformation towards a sustainable society, 4. Health Wellbeing and Environmental Change, 5. Earth System under Global Change, and 6. Disaster Prevention, Mitigation and Recovery. To promote sustainable scientific research, after reporting to the hospital for approval every year according to the recommendations of the Sustainable Advisory Committee, set the theme and detailed objectives of the annual plan solicitation (detailed annual solicitation instructions). The main research promotion is still based on the six major directions.

plan application.title: Sustainability Science Research Program 3
plan application.question: What types of solicitation are there for sustainable scientific research proposals?
plan application.answer: There are two main types of solicitation for this plan, namely: 1. Three-year integrated and single-integrated plan (the subject of solicitation is announced regularly every year). 2. Promote active planning (Top-down) plans from time to time (in principle, the implementation period is within 1 year).

plan application.title: Sustainability Science Research Program 4
plan application.question: Is the Sustainability Science Research Project Briefing Session held in late April every year?
plan application.answer: Yes, every year in late April, a project solicitation briefing will be held.

plan application.title: Sustainability Science Research Program 5
plan application.question: The deadline for applications for sustainable scientific research programs is the end of June every year, right?
plan application.answer: That's right, the deadline for program applications is late June each year (about the end of the month).

plan application.title: Sustainability Science Research Program 6
plan application.question: After the approval of the sustainable scientific research plan, it will usually be announced in November, and then it will be implemented in January of the following year?
plan application.answer: Yes, approved programs are usually announced in November and then implemented in January of the following year.

plan application.title: Sustainability Science Research Program 7
plan application.question: How to invite external scholars to join the research team of the sustainable science research project?
plan application.answer: To invite outsiders to join the research team, you can communicate with experts in fields related to the annual theme during the plan solicitation period, introduce the project content and goals to them, and ask them about their willingness to participate in joint research. If the conditions are suitable, they can be invited to join the team and jointly develop the project application. During the implementation of the plan, if you want to invite scholars outside the academy to join the research team, it will be regarded as a change in the plan and must be reported to Academia Sinica for approval.

plan application.title: Sustainability Science Research Program 8
plan application.question: What is the upper limit of funding for this integrated sustainable science research project?
plan application.answer: This integrated sustainable science project does not have a clear upper limit for funding applications, but the principle is that the total funding for the project should not exceed NT$20 million.

plan application.title: Sustainability Science Research Program 9
plan application.question: How to determine the reasonable implementation funds for sustainable scientific research projects?
plan application.answer: Reasonable implementation costs are determined by consensus at the review meeting. Appropriate funding will be approved at the review meeting based on the theme and scale of cooperation of each project. However, in principle, the total project funding should not exceed 20 million yuan.

plan application.title: Sustainability Science Research Program 10
plan application.question: Where can I find more detailed instructions on the overall promotion of the Sustainability Science Research Program?
plan application.answer: You can find more details about the overall promotion of the Sustainable Science Project at this website: http://www.cfss.sinica.edu.tw/.

plan application.title: Biotechnology Research Park Translational (BRPT) Project 2
plan application.question: What are the six biomedical fields that the mission-oriented biotechnology research program mainly focuses on?
plan application.answer: This program mainly conducts research on six major biomedical fields: precision medicine/cancer treatment, infectious diseases, neurodegenerative diseases, metabolic diseases, innovative medical applications and innovative detection technologies.

plan application.title: Biotechnology Research Park Translational (BRPT) Project 3
plan application.question: Which teams with specific R&D experience are the mission-oriented biotechnology research projects going to help?
plan application.answer: This mission-oriented biotechnology research project is mainly to help teams with experience in the development of small molecule drugs, antibody drugs, nucleic acid drugs, nano drugs, cell therapy and medical materials.

plan application.title: Biotechnology Research Park Translational (BRPT) Project 4
plan application.question: How long is the ultimate goal of the mission-oriented biotechnology research project to turn the research results into commercially valuable product technologies?
plan application.answer: The ultimate goal of the project is to turn research results into commercially valuable product technologies within 3 to 5 years.

plan application.title: Biotechnology Research Park Translational (BRPT) Project 5
plan application.question: Projects that have passed the review of the mission-oriented biotechnology research plan can be stationed in the National Biotechnology Research Park for implementation, so what support and resources will the park provide?
plan application.answer: The National Biotechnology Research Park has a variety of experimental spaces for the translation team to settle in, and assists the translation team to conduct value-added experiments through world-class core facilities. At the same time, combining the regular forums, educational training, speeches and other activities held by the Academy of National Biotechnology Research Park, as well as resources such as patents, competitors and market databases, can improve the business thinking and skills of the translation team and cultivate biotechnology and medical entrepreneurial talents. You can refer to the official website (https://nbrp.sinica.edu.tw/) for more detailed information.

plan application.title: Biotechnology Research Park Translational (BRPT) Project 6
plan application.question: How many years is the implementation time principle of the mission-oriented biotechnology research project?
plan application.answer: The principle of execution time of this plan is 3-5 years.

plan application.title: Biotechnology Research Park Translational (BRPT) Project 7
plan application.question: The principle of implementation time for task-oriented biotechnology research projects is 3-5 years, so how is the amount of funding determined according to the needs? Will there be a cap?
plan application.answer: The amount of funding for this project is determined according to the needs of each research team, that is to say, it will be arranged according to the research plan and budget proposed by the team.

plan application.title: Biotechnology Research Park Translational (BRPT) Project 8
plan application.question: When is the annual application period for the Mission-Oriented Biotechnology Research Program?
plan application.answer: The application period is approximately between April and July each year.

plan application.title: Biotechnology Research Park Translational (BRPT) Project 9
plan application.question: In which month is the deadline for submission of task-oriented biotechnology research proposals?
plan application.answer: The deadline for proposal submissions is mid-July.

plan application.title: Biotechnology Research Park Translational (BRPT) Project 10
plan application.question: The review process of the task-oriented biotechnology research project goes through several stages. In which month will the applications that pass the review be announced?
plan application.answer: The review process has gone through three stages: written preliminary review, committee review and joint final review meeting. Approved applications are usually announced in November.

plan application.title: Biotechnology Research Park Translational (BRPT) Project 11
plan application.question: In what month does the approved plan of the task-oriented biotechnology research plan that has passed the review usually start to be implemented?
plan application.answer: Approved plans that pass the review will generally be implemented in January of the following year.

plan application.title: Infectious Diseases Research (IDR) Project 1
plan application.question: What should be done in response to the epidemic research plan?
plan application.answer: This epidemic response research plan is mainly to integrate the research capabilities of infectious diseases in the hospital, so that different units can cooperate in the research and development of detection technology, drugs, antibodies, vaccines and pathogenic mechanisms. It will also provide interdisciplinary laboratory support and use various related resources to establish a complete epidemiological research and development environment to enhance overall research capabilities. The plan hopes to establish a key technology platform and drug resource library for the prevention and treatment of infectious diseases. In the future, if faced with an outbreak of emerging infectious diseases, rapid screening reagents, antibody drugs, specific drugs and vaccines can be developed in the shortest possible time and quickly provided. Clinical trials and commercialization for industry. These research results will also be stored in the National Research Park, which serves as an important national resource bank for the prevention and control of emerging infectious diseases.

plan application.title: Infectious Diseases Research (IDR) Project 2
plan application.question: What kind of interdisciplinary laboratory support is involved in the research plan for responding to the epidemic?
plan application.answer: The interdisciplinary laboratory support provided by this project includes related resources such as molecular structure, antibody development, animal models and P3 laboratories.

plan application.title: Infectious Diseases Research (IDR) Project 3
plan application.question: How can research programs in response to epidemics shorten the time to develop rapid screening reagents, antibody drugs and vaccines?
plan application.answer: This plan gathers the infectious disease research capacity in the hospital and cooperates with various units to invest in the research and development of detection technology, drugs, antibodies, vaccines and pathogenic mechanisms. At the same time, it provides cross-field laboratory support and related resources, such as molecular structure, antibody research and development, animal models and P3 laboratories, etc., and is expected to accelerate the development of rapid screening reagent prototypes, antibody drugs and vaccines and other products. In this way, these products can be quickly provided to the industry for use in the event of an outbreak of an emerging infectious disease, shortening the development time.

plan application.title: Infectious Diseases Research (IDR) Project 4
plan application.question: When is the application deadline for the Epidemic Response Research Program?
plan application.answer: The time to apply for this program is from April to July each year, first submit the letter of intent in mid-May, and then submit the plan in mid-July.

plan application.title: Infectious Diseases Research (IDR) Project 5
plan application.question: What is the execution time and funding amount of the research plan in response to the epidemic?
plan application.answer: In principle, the implementation time of the plan is 4 years, and the maximum amount of funding per year is NT$20 million.

plan application.title: Digital Humanities Research Project 1
plan application.question: Which unit of Academia Sinica is responsible for promoting the "Digital Humanities Research Project"?
plan application.answer: The "Digital Humanities Research Project" is promoted by the Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures.

plan application.title: Digital Humanities Research Project 2
plan application.question: What is the purpose of promoting the "Digital Humanities Research Project"? What are the core tasks involved?
plan application.answer: The "Digital Humanities Research Project" aims to facilitate the digital transformation of humanities studies. The core tasks include building a digital humanities knowledge base, fostering innovative research in digital humanities, developing and using digital humanities research tools, and publishing academic works and displaying humanities research results in multiple ways.

plan application.title: Digital Humanities Research Project 3
plan application.question: What is the planned process and direction of the "Digital Humanities Research Project"?
plan application.answer: Based on academic research, the Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures integrates various digital cultural assets, continuously enriches digital content, improves the digital humanities research environment, guides the public to participate, and shares digital knowledge. Cross-domain integration and communication.

plan application.title: Digital Humanities Research Project 4
plan application.question: Does the "Digital Humanities Research Project" interact and exchange ideas with related fields globally?
plan application.answer: Yes, the Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures not only participates in international seminars in the field of digital humanities every year, but also establishes different communication and cooperation modes with important relevant units around the world.

plan application.title: Digital Humanities Research Project 5
plan application.question: For more details about the "Digital Humanities Research Project", please refer to https://ascdc.sinica.edu.tw/.
plan application.answer: For more details about the "Digital Humanities Research Project", you can directly refer to https://ascdc.sinica.edu.tw/.
